intro: Codonocalyx divaricatus, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. The flowers are known to bloom in clusters and have a distinctive, mildly fragrant scent.
